summary.para: The IP_ADAPTER_PREFIX structure stores an IP address prefix.

remarks.para: The structure is retrieved by the function. On Windows XP with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later, the FirstPrefix member of the IP_ADAPTER_ADDRESSES structure is a pointer to a linked list of IP_ADAPTER_PREFIX structures.

The structure is used in the IP_ADAPTER_PREFIX structure. On the Microsoft Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) released for Windows Vista and later, the organization of header files has changed and the SOCKET_ADDRESS structure is defined in the Ws2def.h header file which is automatically included by the Winsock2.h header file. On the Platform Software Development Kit (SDK) released for Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP, the SOCKET_ADDRESS structure is declared in the Winsock2.h header file. In order to use the IP_ADAPTER_PREFIX structure, the Winsock2.h header file must be included before the Iphlpapi.h header file.

summary.para: Reserved. Used by the compiler to align the structure.
The length, in bytes, of this structure.
This member is reserved and should be set to zero.
A pointer to the next adapter prefix structure in the list.
The address prefix, in the form of a structure.
The length of the prefix, in bits.
